I support this but if this was the case amethyst geodes must be very hard to find and only the amethyst clusters can be fortuned for more this makes exploring caves more exciting and fun whilst rewarding players for locating them giving them a good decent amount of shards for tinted glass or amethyst blocks and you can continue farming the budding amethyst but you only get a limited amount of amethyst blocks from natural generation this makes storing it much easier whilst also giving reasons for players to explore more than just sit and watch your amethyst shard farm do all the work for you.

I think this is a wonderful idea, while amethyst blocks are pretty they're kind of pointless aside from being used as decoration. I cleared out some geodes to make an amethyst "farm" since amethyst buds or the blocks they grow on can't be moved. And while I enjoy having to trek into a cave every time I needed amethyst shards it would be nice if I could do something productive with my amethyst blocks besides decorate my enchantment room or have it take up space in a storage chest. Maybe make it so the Cleric villager will trade amethyst for emeralds or like one of the other users mentioned about the amethyst acting like glowstone and only getting a little bit back per block.
perhaps they make it so w/o silk touch, it drops 1-3 amythest but with silk touch you get the full block

well, since to have storage, matching other gems, it could be good to have aside normal amethyst block, if proplem think you would have too much too easily by getting one geode (you still get ton of those fast anyway), some storage version of 9 pieces to uncraft then, so it would let you store more amethysts and also not making to easy to mine geodes to get more, and also we could ahve some amethyst block that would not look as bad for using in some builds as decoration
similarly I would like to be able to uncraft quartz blocks or have some quartz storage blocks

Maybe there could be Sapphire armor, that when wearing a full suit, it gives you water breathing.
Maybe they could add Prismarine Ruins and make Sapphire Ore a variation of Prismarine.

I really don't think we should have another armor set literally after the Nether Update making that armor set basically useless because now it's "Stronger" than the old one. It just ruins the game pointlessly if we toped each update with another better armor set that is stronger than the next. It took 10 years to add another armor set stronger than diamonds so we should wait a while to make another armor set/tool set.
um SpringyToast735, yes it would be pointless to add "Stronger" armor and tools right after 1.16, but it would take a long time to have this be voted and added.
With the new caves and cliffs, I think it should be a little rarer than netherite.

okay, not sure why there are only 13 votes cause I love this idea but maybe not rarer than netherite, but rarer than redstone, and could be stronger than iron. It's not OP, but it is strong and would look really good in my mind. maybe the gold ore texture combined with the redstone ore texture but blue for it's ore texture? IDK I just think it would be really interesting to see sapphire in the game, especially if there are more crafting recipes other than armor/tools like copper or iron. However, do you know what would TRULY be interesting? obsidian armor, emerald armor, and copper armor! Now that would be a cool update!!! (FYI: they would be the strength you think they would be, but not stronger than netherite or diamonds or all that OP stuff). Ooh Ooh! And maybe yellow variants rarer than blue variants, I mean variants for ores...C O O L!!!

Yeah I agree that it should probably only be stronger than iron, because you have to go to the nether and all that for netherite, as well as getting the netherite upgrade trim, making it hard to get, and so adding another ore that can be found in the overworld and making it stronger would make it not worth it to go looking for netherite, and make it pointless. But yeah good idea!

And it will be much better if you can only craft it in a 6x6 crafting table that can be found in strongholds.. What do you think?? Its just a suggestion from no one...

Can you describe the reason for doing so? For the floor I prefer to use whole wool blocks, while carpet can be used for rugs rather than the whole floor.
Having a bed that I can't place on a rug is maddening. What is the point of carpet that can't have anything on it. that's what carpet is for. I fully endorse this suggestion.

I truly like this idea, I am a huge modded minecraft fan, and play with a 1.12 mod called Gems++. I think some ores should be used for new armors, or fantasy items like "boots of lava walking" or maybe just more enchants.
This idea is very good, agree, because the cave and cliff update only update the copper mine, nothing else.
No it has been stone since the beginning and it always will.
We need add shale
Yeah, i think "stone" need more spesific name

I know to a lot of people this is very controversial because of the nostalgia, and because how stone is characteristic to the game, but think about it logically for a few moments. Aside from all geological implications, this would be a very logical step gameplay wise. Stone simply refers to any type of rock. This made sense when there were no different types of rocks in Minecraft, it's all just stone. But then they added Granite, Andesite, Diorite and Blackstone. Even to that extent it would have still been okay, because Stone was still the only rock found all throughout the underground, so a general name still works. Then Deepslate was added, and now it makes absolutely no sense. If there could be a dominant type of stone with a complete section of its own in the underground, and still have a unique and real-world based name, then why is "the stone that appears above Y=0/regular stone" an exception? It's now so redundant and mind-aching to try and refer to the blocked called Stone; the game is litterally giving us tongue-twisters and that is definitely not good accessibility, especially for multiplayer. Communicating about what you find underground or more likely what you're building is just painful right now, and I don't think we should have to live with it because of pointless nostalgia reasons. The game needs to progress and should only look behind to reflect, not to stick to the past. 1/2

This is a situation a lot like the new ore textures. A lot of people are unhappy because of nostalgia, then quite a few realize "Wait, is this actually a small quality of life change that has little impact on how I play the game while making it more accessible and eliminating some needless pain, especially for new players? Is that also a change that I can revert with a simple resource pack?". Yes, and yes! Just imagine trying to describe the game to a new player with the current situation: "Below Y=0 you find Deepslate, based on slate from the real world, then above Y=0 you find a....uh..just stone, which makes perfect sense even though we do indeed have a ton of stone varieties and we have a counterpart for one of the two most common real world rocks. We're just missing the other one even though we have a perfect spot for it. You'll get used to it, mate." With that change it would just become Shale and Deepslate; makes sense to everybody from both a real world and game perspective, which a lot of new players definitely need so that the game feels inviting to them and they don't have to go through all of that mess and confusion when they just started. 2/2
